alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Monroe (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 13 at 12:51PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Monroe and northern Clarke Counties through 130 PM CDT... At 1251 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 9 miles east of Coffeeville, or 10 miles northwest of Grove Hill, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Grove Hill, Whatley, Coffeeville and Fulton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CDT for south central and southwestern Alabama.
